titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize LJS 486: Kitāb Alghāz fī al-lughah al-ʻArabīyah.

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Oversize LJS 486: Kitāb Alghāz fī al-lughah al-ʻArabīyah. are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

notesStmt.note: Notations on front flyleaf, including an owner's note? dated 994 A.H. (1586 CE).

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Compilation of riddles drawn from early Islamic and pre-Islamic poetry, arranged in alphabetical order by their answers.

supportDesc.extent: 93 leaves : 280 x 180 (196 x 115) mm bound to 280 x 184 mm

collation.p: Paper, 93; 1¹⁴ 2⁶ 3¹⁴ 4⁶ 5¹⁴ 6⁶ 7¹⁴ 8⁶ 9¹⁴( -1); [1-93], modern foliation in pencil, upper left recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in up to 29 long lines. Catchwords on each leaf, lower left verso.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in naskh in black ink; pointed, with headings in thuluth.

decoDesc.decoNote: Rubrications in red; puzzles in decorative layouts added in ink on front flyleaf by a later hand (f. 1r).

binding.p: Light brown leather, blind-stamped with central mandorla and two pendants on the vertical axis, rebacked.

origin.p: Likely copied in Egypt, dated A.H. 17 Rajab 720 (August 1320 CE) (f. 92v and inscription on title page, f. 3r).

history.provenance: Formerly owned by Sayyid Maḥmūd bin Nāṣir (inscription in Maghribī hand recording purchase in Egypt in A.H. 1076 (1665-1666), f. 3r.
Formerly in the library of the al-Zāwiyah al-Nāṣiriyah at Tamegroute, Morocco, founded by the Bin Nāṣir family in the 17th century (stamped seals, f. 2r, 3r).
Sold by Sam Fogg Ltd. (London) to Lawrence J. Schoenberg, Jul. 2007.
Deposit by Lawrence J. Schoenberg and Barbara Brizdle, 2012.
